app.title: Microsoft 365 Copilot
app.description:
The Microsoft 365 Copilot app is your everyday productivity app for work and life that helps you find and edit files, scan documents, and create content on the go with access to Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat*, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDFs all in one app. (formerly the Microsoft 365 (Office) app)

With Copilot for work, easily ask, create, and draft in a simplified chat experience to boost productivity.

*Copilot Chat in the Microsoft 365 Copilot app is available for Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Academic, SMB, Personal and Family subscribers with a work, education, or personal account. It is available in these supported languages: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/supported-languages-for-microsoft-copilot-94518d61-644b-4118-9492-617eea4801d8.

Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Copilot all in one app:
• Collaborate with Copilot, your AI assistant, to catch up, ask questions, and draft content.
• Use Word to write and edit documents like resumes with professional templates.
• Use PowerPoint with tools like Presenter Coach to practice your presentation.
• Use Excel to manage your budget with spreadsheet templates.
• Try Designer* to create designs and edit photos in seconds with the power of AI.
*Designer is only available for personal Microsoft accounts. A Microsoft 365 Personal and Family subscription will be required to continue using premium features.

PDF capabilities:
• Scan PDF files and convert them into Word documents with the PDF converter tool.
• Edit PDF files on your device quickly and easily while on the go.
• PDF Reader allows you to access and sign PDFs.

Access and save documents to the cloud by connecting a Microsoft Account (for OneDrive or SharePoint) or by connecting to a third-party cloud storage provider. Logging in with a personal Microsoft account or a work or school account connected to a Microsoft 365 subscription will unlock premium features within the app.

Subscription & Privacy Disclaimer

Monthly Microsoft 365 Personal and Family subscriptions purchased from the app will be charged to your App Store account and will automatically renew within 24 hours prior to the end of the current subscription period unless auto-renewal is disabled beforehand. You can manage your subscriptions in your App Store account settings.

This app is provided by either Microsoft or a third-party app publisher and is subject to a separate privacy statement and terms and conditions. Data provided using this store and this app may be accessible to Microsoft or the third-party app publisher, as applicable, and transferred to, stored and processed in the United States or any other country where Microsoft or the app publisher and their affiliates or service providers maintain facilities.

Please refer to Microsoft's EULA for Terms of Service for Microsoft 365. By installing the app, you agree to these terms and conditions: https://support.office.com/legal?llcc=en-gb&aid=SoftwareLicensingTerms_en-gb.htm

reviews.text: Productivity gets better with time and expanded integrations. There is a reason Microsoft is and has been the business productivity go-to for decades. I've used Copilot since its prominence gained traction, before it was folded into the whole Microsoft Office ecosystem. I found the integration improved user's workflow, but always promote not taking the easy way out, and to use your own creativity as a base starting point. The possibilities are limitless.

I wish I knew how to use everything . Why doesn't my Microsoft 365 copilot start after I've logged in on my Android? I've had nothing but problems with all Microsoft apps. I've reached out to yoir customer service 20 times. I've filled.out forms and still Noone gets back to me.. I.pay $14.00.a .month now. I've been a paying client for almost 6 years. help.me!!!!!

Microsoft 365 combined Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and more all in one platform. There are no significant bugs I am experiencing when using the application. The application is quite excellent in my opinion. I absolutely hope new features will continue to be added that improves and enhances Microsoft 365. Well done Microsoft!

Microsoft 365(Office) is very beneficial for any organisation network, completely for any studies through reading and well deserved to be used in every household, especially the next generation with the opportunity to achieve the necessary information in place. So I recommend to any work situation and recognise it is easy access trust you will be able to save time downloading and believe you will see results in your plans to adapt in any way possible. Including yearly payments, very affordable.

I'm a pretty hard guy to make happy but I'm actually really impressed with microsoft. I started full google but made all slight transition due to 1 program and then I kept finding more that were just really cool. my only 1 complaint. is that I find it a little difficult to navigate off the hop but once you get familiar it gets better... and to be honest it's really not bad spending time exploring cool little unexpected tidbits you never would've found otherwise. all in all. very impressed!

I don't like being FORCED into things. And being forced into AI, Is big No to me. Already working on trying to transfer documents from one drive to close accounts with microsoft. However they don't make it easy for someone who doesn't own a computer. Mobile devices are all I have and I can't move anything from OneDrive not even through the Internet. Another good reason to drop Microsoft.

Won't sync. Very annoying. No matter how often I save my document from my desk top copilot only wants to open a version of the file from 3 months ago. Although the app works for some things, this makes it a lot less useful and a lot more frustrating. From 5 stars to 2. Please fix, I really appreciated being able to access my files remotely.

I use it to sync my work between my laptop, phone, and tablet. It is amazing when it works. However, I have begun having issues over the last year with the app on my phone and tablet not syncing updated work. No matter how many times you force a sync, it will not pull in any docs. (And yes, I did check for updates each time, and there were none) The only solution I've found thus far is to completely remove the app and re-download it. After that, there are no more issues.

Utter clown show. Microsoft continue to make their offering worse, less reliable, and less professional through the compulsory addition of poorly implemented and just plain broken AI features. It has gotten to the point that correcting AI mistakes and finding workarounds has become a significant impediment to just doing my job. At every opportunity I'm choosing to work in alternative products.

Pain in the rear end. Try to sign in, and I get "Trying to sign you in from another app. Please try again later." I DON'T WANT to stay signed in. This inability to sign in easily frequently makes me use another app. I don't want every single document I view to be put in the cloud. But I also don't want to this major hassle every single time I do try to use it.

app.AIReview:
Microsoft 365 Copilot Review

Overview

Microsoft 365 Copilot is a productivity app designed to streamline workflows across various Microsoft 365 applications, aiming to be an all-in-one solution for both professional and personal use. With over 1.27 billion installs and a robust rating of 4.64, it represents Microsoft's significant investment in integrating AI directly into its flagship suite. The app’s core functionality revolves around leveraging the power of Copilot – previously known as Microsoft 365 (Office) – to assist users with tasks ranging from document creation and editing to data analysis and file management. This review will dissect the app’s features, usability, value proposition, and potential drawbacks based on its current offerings and user feedback.

Key Features

The app's functionality is built around several key components:

  • Copilot Chat: The central hub of the experience, Copilot Chat allows users to interact with the AI through natural language prompts. It’s designed for drafting emails, summarizing documents, generating presentations, and even assisting with spreadsheet calculations – all within a conversational interface.
  • Microsoft 365 App Integration: Copilot seamlessly integrates with core Microsoft 365 applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDFs. Users can directly access Copilot’s capabilities while working within these apps. For example, within Word, you could ask Copilot to rewrite a paragraph for clarity or generate different writing styles.
  • File Management Assistance: The app provides tools to quickly locate and manage files stored within your Microsoft 365 environment, accelerating the process of finding necessary documents.
  • Document Scanning: Copilot can now scan physical documents using your device’s camera and convert them into editable digital formats – a feature that significantly enhances productivity for those who frequently work with paper-based materials.
  • Content Creation Tools: Beyond just editing, Copilot actively assists in content creation by generating outlines, suggesting visuals, and offering writing prompts to facilitate the development of presentations, reports, and other documents.

Strengths

Several aspects contribute to the app’s strong performance:

  • Powerful AI Capabilities: The core strength lies undeniably in its AI engine (Copilot). The ability to generate text, summarize information, and perform calculations with a simple chat command dramatically reduces time spent on repetitive tasks. For instance, generating an initial draft of a marketing report using Copilot Chat is significantly faster than starting from scratch.
  • Seamless Integration: The deep integration with Microsoft 365 applications is exceptionally well-executed. Users don't need to switch between apps frequently; the AI assistance is readily available within their existing workflow.
  • Broad Application Support: The app’s compatibility with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDFs makes it a valuable tool for professionals across diverse industries.
  • Large User Base & Positive Reviews: The high install count (1.27 billion) and impressive rating (4.64/5) demonstrate significant user satisfaction. This indicates the app effectively addresses real-world productivity needs.

Areas for Improvement

Despite its strengths, Copilot has areas that require refinement:

  • Copilot Chat Access Restrictions: The fact that Copilot Chat functionality is tiered based on Microsoft 365 subscription levels is a potential barrier to entry for many users. The ‘available for Microsoft 365 Enterprise, A…’ note suggests limitations for smaller or individual accounts.
  • Output Quality Variability: While generally impressive, the quality of Copilot’s generated content can be inconsistent. Complex requests often yield less accurate results than simpler ones. Further refinement of the AI model is needed to improve output accuracy and coherence.
  • Over-Reliance Concerns: There's a risk that users might become overly reliant on Copilot, potentially hindering their own critical thinking and writing skills.
  • Contextual Understanding: While improving, the app still occasionally struggles with maintaining context across longer conversations or complex document edits.

User Experience

The user experience is generally intuitive, mirroring the familiar interface of Microsoft 365 applications. The conversational style of Copilot Chat feels natural, and the integration with existing apps makes it easy to adopt. However, navigating the various prompts and options within Copilot Chat can sometimes feel overwhelming, particularly for first-time users. Clearer tutorials and onboarding would greatly improve this aspect. The visual design is clean and modern, aligning well with Microsoft’s overall brand aesthetic.

Value for Money

At a free price point, Microsoft 365 Copilot offers substantial value to casual users and those experimenting with AI productivity tools. However, the full potential of the app – particularly the advanced features of Copilot Chat – is unlocked through paid Microsoft 365 subscriptions. Determining whether the cost of these subscriptions justifies the added productivity gains will depend heavily on individual user needs and usage patterns.

Conclusion

Microsoft 365 Copilot represents a bold step for Microsoft in integrating AI into its core productivity suite. Its strengths—particularly the seamless integration with Microsoft 365 applications and the powerful capabilities of Copilot Chat—make it a valuable tool for boosting productivity across various tasks. While inconsistencies in output quality and access restrictions to certain features remain challenges, the app’s overwhelmingly positive user reviews and massive install base demonstrate its potential. The free tier offers an accessible entry point, and users should continue to monitor future updates as Microsoft refines the AI engine and expands the functionality of Copilot Chat. It's a promising tool that will undoubtedly evolve significantly in the coming months.
